summary: This bill, titled the "Miracle on Ice Congressional Gold Medal Act," authorizes the award of three Congressional Gold Medals to the members of the 1980 U.S. Olympic Men’s Ice Hockey Team. It recognizes their historic victory over the Soviet Union, an achievement that boosted American morale during the Cold War and transformed U.S. hockey. The bill directs the Secretary of the Treasury to design and strike the medals, which will be presented on behalf of Congress and then given for public display to the Lake Placid Olympic Center, the U.S. Hockey Hall of Fame, and the U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Museum.
